question: Vapour pressure of a solution containing 18 g of glucose and 178.2 g of water at <katex>$100^{\circ}C$</katex> is:
(Vapour pressure of pure water at <katex>$100^{\circ}C=760$</katex> torr)
explanation: Moles Glucose = 18/180 = 0.1. Moles Water = 178.2/18 = 9.9. Mole fraction water = 9.9/10 = 0.99. VP = 760 * 0.99 = 752.4 torr.
